snippet: The desktop interface, called "windows, icons, menus, pointer," or WIMP, never seemed to work for most people. What has worked in intuitive computing is iOS, which continues to make its way onto the desktop.
abstract: The desktop interface, called "windows, icons, menus, pointer," or WIMP, never seemed to work for most people. What has worked in intuitive computing is iOS, which continues to make its way onto the desktop.

headline.main: Desktop Computers Look More and More Like Smartphones
